result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Michael Loest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called @ 1:15 PM: Return on Warrant:  Defendant Justin Michael Loest in court with attorney Angela Wang, both appearing via video.  Defendant Justin Michael Loest in custody.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA extends offer on resolution.   Def FTA for SEH hearing.   Per Atty Wang - Def wishes to resolve matter today and participate via video.  Court entertains waiver of personal appearance for SEH.   ADA recites recommendation for probation sentence - it appears that AODA had been commenced in Marquette Co.  Argument as to SEH by Atty Wang.  The Court:  90 days WCJ  - I/S - GT and Huber - 2 days TS credit; S/W - 1 yr probation.  Conditions:    The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP with DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Appeal Rights Given.
from the DE to the Court

Case called @ 1:55 p.m. Defendant Justin Michael Loest not in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE faxed a letter to the Court approximately an hour prior to Court. The defendant did not provide the Court with current address information. Court authorizes the issuance of a bench warrant extraditable State of Wisconsin. Cash Bond ordered forfeited. The Court will allow the defendant to request a voluntary appearance in writing but the defendant must appear in person for the hearing.
